title: 108_s2233
content: The Act may be cited as the "Environmental Research Enhancement Act". It pertains to Environmental Protection Agency research activities. The Environmental Research Enhancement Act establishes the position of Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency, appointed by the President with Senate approval. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency is appointed by the President with Senate approval, considering recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences, the National Academy of Engineering, and the Science Advisory Board. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency coordinates and oversees recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences, the National Academy of Engineering, and the Science Advisory Board. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology oversees the Office of Research and Development, the Office of Environmental Information, the Science Advisory Board, the Science Policy Council, and scientific and technical activities within the Agency. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology is responsible for overseeing the Science Advisory Board, Science Policy Council, and scientific and technical activities within the Agency. They also ensure that important scientific issues facing the Agency are identified and defined. The Administrator for Science and Technology oversees the identification and definition of important scientific issues within the Agency and develops a strategy to acquire and disseminate necessary scientific information. The Administrator for Science and Technology develops a strategy to acquire and disseminate necessary scientific information through intramural and extramural programs involving academia, government agencies, and the private sector in the United States and foreign countries. The goal is to ensure that the complex scientific outreach and communication needs of the Agency are met. The Agency's outreach and communication needs are met by reaching out for credible science to support regulatory, regional, and Agency-wide policy deliberations, as well as engaging with the broader US and international scientific community for relevant knowledge. The Agency reaches out to the US and international scientific community for relevant knowledge to support policy and regulatory issues, coordinates scientific quality assurance and peer-review activities, and develops processes for ensuring scientific integrity. The Agency coordinates quality assurance and peer review activities to ensure valid scientific information is used in decision-making for regulatory and policy issues. The Agency ensures that scientific and technical information used in regulatory decisions is valid, characterized in terms of uncertainty, and appropriately applied. The Office for Research and Development aims to improve decision-making processes by enhancing documentation and transparency, establishing research priorities, making assignments, and allocating funds. The position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is being redesignated as the "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency." Any references to the Deputy Administrator in laws, regulations, or other records will now refer to the Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management.
